text: Frank Russell Capra (born Francesco Rosario Capra; May 18, 1897 - September 3, 1991) was a Sicilian-American movie director, movie producer and screenwriter. He won three Oscars from his six nominations as Best Director. His best known movies are It Happened One Night (1934), You Can't Take It with You (1938), Mr. Smith Goes to Washington (1939) and It's a Wonderful Life (1946). ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:Academy Award winning directors Category:Golden Globe Award winning directors Category:1897 births Category:1991 deaths Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Anti-communists Category:American movie directors Category:American movie producers Category:American screenwriters Category:American military personnel of World War I Category:American military personnel of World War II Category:People from Sicily
title: Frank Capra
